Raag Maaroo − Part 001 989 : 1 Raag Maaroo, First Mehl, First House, Chau−Padas: 989 : 2 One Universal Creator God. Truth Is The Name. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying. Beyond Birth. Self−Existent. By Guru's Grace: 989 : 3 Shalok: 989 : 4 O my Friend, I shall forever remain the dust of Your feet. 989 : 5 Nanak seeks Your protection, and beholds You ever−present, here and now. ||1|| 989 : 6 SHABAD: 989 : 7 Those who receive the call in the last hours of the night, chant the Name of their Lord and Master. 989 : 8 Tents, canopies, pavilions and carriages are prepared and made ready for them. 989 : 9 You send out the call, Lord, to those who meditate on Your Name. ||1|| 2

989 : 10 Father, I am unfortunate, a fraud. 989 : 11 I have not found Your Name; my mind is blind and deluded by doubt. ||1||Pause|| 989 : 12 I have enjoyed the tastes, and now my pains have come to fruition; such is my pre−ordained destiny, O my mother. 989 : 13 Now my joys are few, and my pains are many. In utter agony, I pass my life. ||2|| 989 : 14 What separation could be worse than separation from the Lord? For those who are united with Him, what other union can there be? 989 : 15 Praise the Lord and Master, who, having created this play, beholds it. ||3|| 989 : 16 By good destiny, this union comes about; this body enjoys its pleasures. 989 : 17 Those who have lost their destiny, suffer separation from this union. O Nanak, they may still be united once again! ||4||1|| 989 : 18 Maaroo, First Mehl: 989 : 19 Raag Maaroo − Part 001 3

The union of the mother and father brings the body into being. 989 : 20 The Creator inscribes upon it the inscription of its destiny. 989 : 21 According to this inscription, gifts, light and glorious greatness are received. 989 : 22 Joining with Maya, the spiritual consciousness is lost. ||1|| 989 : 23 O foolish mind, why are you so proud? 989 : 24 You shall have to arise and depart when it pleases your Lord and Master. ||1||Pause|| 989 : 25 Abandon the tastes of the world, and find intuitive peace. 989 : 26 All must abandon their worldly homes; no one remains here forever. 989 : 27 Eat some, and save the rest, 989 : 28 if you are destined to return to the world again. ||2|| 989 : 29 Raag Maaroo − Part 001 4

He adorns his body and ress in silk robes. 989 : 30 He issues all sorts of commands. 989 : 31 Preparing his comfortable bed, he sleeps. 989 : 32 When he falls into the hands of the Messenger of Death, what good does it do to cry out? ||3|| 989 : 33 Household affairs are whirlpools of entanglements, O Siblings of Destiny. −− Raag Maaroo − Part 001 −− Raag Maaroo − Part 001 5

Raag Maaroo − Part 002 990 : 34 Sin is a stone which does not float. 990 : 35 So let the Fear of God be the boat to carry your soul across. 990 : 36 Says Nanak, rare are those who are blessed with this Boat. ||4||2|| 990 : 37 Maaroo, First Mehl, First House: 990 : 38 Actions are the paper, and the mind is the ink; good and bad are both recorded upon it. 990 : 39 As their past actions drive them, so are mortals driven. There is no end to Your Glorious Virtues, Lord. ||1|| 990 : 40 Why do you not keep Him in your consciousness, you mad man? 990 : 41 Forgetting the Lord, your own virtues shall rot away. ||1||Pause|| 990 : 42 The night is a net, and the day is a net; there are as many traps as there are moments. 6

990 : 43 With relish and delight, you continually bite at the bait; you are trapped, you fool − how will you ever escape? ||2|| 990 : 44 The body is a furnace, and the mind is the iron within it; the five fires are heating it. 990 : 45 Sin is the charcoal placed upon it, which burns the mind; the tongs are anxiety and worry. ||3|| 990 : 46 What was turned to slag is again transformed into gold, if one meets with the Guru. 990 : 47 He blesses the mortal with the Ambrosial Name of the One Lord, and then, O Nanak, the body is held steady. ||4||3|| 990 : 48 Maaroo, First Mehl: 990 : 49 In the pure, immaculate waters, both the lotus and the slimy scum are found. 990 : 50 The lotus flower is with the scum and the water, but it remains untouched by any pollution. ||1|| 990 : 51 You frog, you will never understand. Raag Maaroo − Part 002 7

990 : 52 You eat the dirt, while you dwell in the immaculate waters. You know nothing of the ambrosial nectar there. ||1||Pause|| 990 : 53 You dwell continually in the water; the bumble bee does not dwell there, but it is intoxicated with its fragrance from afar. 990 : 54 Intuitively sensing the moon in the distance, the lotus bows its head. ||2|| 990 : 55 The realms of nectar are irrigated with milk and honey; you think you are clever to live in the water. 990 : 56 You can never escape your own inner tendencies, like the love of the flea for blood. ||3|| 990 : 57 The fool may live with the Pandit, the religious scholar, and listen to the Vedas and the Shaastras. 990 : 58 You can never escape your own inner tendencies, like the crooked tail of the dog. ||4|| 990 : 59 Some are hypocrites; they do not merge with the Naam, the Name of the Lord. Some are absorbed in the Feet of the Lord, Har, Har. 990 : 60 The mortals obtain what they are predestined to receive; O Nanak, with your tongue, chant the Naam. ||5||4|| Raag Maaroo − Part 002 8

990 : 61 Maaroo, First Mehl, 990 : 62 Shalok: 990 : 63 Countless sinners are sanctified, attaching their minds to the Feet of the Lord. 990 : 64 The merits of the sixty−eight places of pilgrimage are found in God's Name, O Nanak, when such destiny is inscribed upon one's forehead. ||1|| 990 : 65 SHABAD: 990 : 66 O friends and companions, so puffed up with pride, 990 : 67 listen to this one joyous story of your Husband Lord. ||1|| 990 : 68 Who can I tell about my pain, O my mother? 990 : 69 Without the Lord, my soul cannot survive; how can I comfort it, O my mother? ||1||Pause|| 990 : 70 I am a dejected, discarded bride, totally miserable. Raag Maaroo − Part 002 9

990 : 71 I have lost my youth; I regret and repent. ||2|| 990 : 72 You are my wise Lord and Master, above my head. 990 : 73 I serve You as Your humble slave. ||3|| 990 : 74 Nanak humbly prays, this is my only concern: 990 : 75 without the Blessed Vision of my Beloved, how can I enjoy Him? ||4||5|| −− Raag Maaroo − Part 002 −− Raag Maaroo − Part 002 10

Raag Maaroo − Part 003 991 : 76 Maaroo, First Mehl: 991 : 77 I am Your slave, Your bonded servant, and so I am called fortunate. 991 : 78 I sold myself at Your store in exchange for the Guru's Word; whatever You link me to, to that I am linked. ||1|| 991 : 79 What cleverness can Your servant try with You? 991 : 80 O my Lord and Master, I cannot carry out the Hukam of Your Command. ||1||Pause|| 991 : 81 My mother is Your slave, and my father is Your slave; I am the child of Your slaves. 991 : 82 My slave mother dances, and my slave father sings; I practice devotional worship to You, O my Sovereign Lord. ||2|| 991 : 83 If You wish to drink, then I shall get water for You; if You wish to eat, I shall grind the corn for You. 991 : 84 11

I wave the fan over You, and wash Your feet, and continue to chant Your Name. ||3|| 991 : 85 I have been untrue to myself, but Nanak is Your slave; please forgive him, by Your glorious greatness. 991 : 86 Since the very beginning of time, and throughout the ages, You have been the merciful and generous Lord. Without You, liberation cannot be attained. ||4||6|| 991 : 87 Maaroo, First Mehl: 991 : 88 Some call him a ghost; some say that he is a demon. 991 : 89 Some call him a mere mortal; O, poor Nanak! ||1|| 991 : 90 Crazy Nanak has gone insane, after his Lord, the King. 991 : 91 I know of none other than the Lord. ||1||Pause|| 991 : 92 He alone is known to be insane, when he goes insane with the Fear of God. 991 : 93 He recognizes none other than the One Lord and Master. ||2|| Raag Maaroo − Part 003 12

991 : 94 He alone is known to be insane, if he works for the One Lord. 991 : 95 Recognizing the Hukam, the Command of his Lord and Master, what other cleverness is there? ||3|| 991 : 96 He alone is known to be insane, when he falls in love with his Lord and Master. 991 : 97 He sees himself as bad, and all the rest of the world as good. ||4||7|| 991 : 98 Maaroo, First Mehl: 991 : 99 This wealth is all−pervading, permeating all. 991 : 100 The self−willed manmukh wanders around, thinking that it is far away. ||1|| 991 : 101 That commodity, the wealth of the Naam, is within my heart. 991 : 102 Whoever You bless with it, is emancipated. ||1||Pause|| 991 : 103 This wealth does not burn; it cannot be stolen by a thief. Raag Maaroo − Part 003 13

991 : 104 This wealth does not drown, and its owner is never punished. ||2|| 991 : 105 Gaze upon the glorious greatness of this wealth, 991 : 106 and your nights and days will pass, imbued with celestial peace. ||3|| 991 : 107 Listen to this incomparably beautiful story, O my brothers, O Siblings of Destiny. 991 : 108 Tell me, without this wealth, who has ever obtained the supreme status? ||4|| 991 : 109 Nanak humbly prays, I proclaim the Unspoken Speech of the Lord. 991 : 110 If one meets the True Guru, then this wealth is obtained. ||5||8|| 991 : 111 Maaroo, First Mehl: 991 : 112 Heat up the sun energy of the right nostril, and cool down the moon energy of the left nostril; practicing this breath−control, bring them into perfect balance. 991 : 113 In this way, the fickle fish of the mind will be held steady; the swan−soul shall not fly away, Raag Maaroo − Part 003 14

and the body−wall will not crumble. ||1|| 991 : 114 You fool, why are you deluded by doubt? 991 : 115 You do not remember the detached Lord of supreme bliss. ||1||Pause|| 991 : 116 Seize and burn the unbearable; seize and kill the imperishable; leave behind your doubts, and then, you shall drink in the Nectar. 991 : 117 In this way, the fickle fish of the mind will be held steady; the swan−soul shall not fly away, and the body−wall shall not crumble. ||2|| −− Raag Maaroo − Part 003 −− Raag Maaroo − Part 003 15

Raag Maaroo − Part 004 992 : 118 Nanak humbly prays, if the Lord's humble servant dwells upon Him, in his mind of minds, with his every breath, then he drinks in the Ambrosial Nectar. 992 : 119 In this way, the fickle fish of the mind will be held steady; the swan−soul shall not fly away, and the body−wall shall not crumble. ||3||9|| 992 : 120 Maaroo, First Mehl: 992 : 121 Maya is not conquered, and the mind is not subdued; the waves of desire in the world−ocean are intoxicating wine. 992 : 122 The boat crosses over the water, carrying the true merchandise. 992 : 123 The jewel within the mind subdues the mind; attached to the Truth, it is not broken. 992 : 124 The king is seated upon the throne, imbued with the Fear of God and the five qualities. ||1|| 992 : 125 O Baba, do not see your True Lord and Master as being far away. 992 : 126 16

He is the Light of all, the Life of the world; The True Lord writes His Inscription on each and every head. ||1||Pause|| 992 : 127 Brahma and Vishnu, the Rishis and the silent sages, Shiva and Indra, penitents and beggars 992 : 128 − whoever obeys the Hukam of the Lord's Command, looks beautiful in the Court of the True Lord, while the stubborn rebels die. 992 : 129 The wandering beggars, warriors, celibates and Sannyaasee hermits − through the Perfect Guru, consider this: 992 : 130 without selfless service, no one ever receives the fruits of their rewards. Serving the Lord is the most excellent action. ||2|| 992 : 131 You are the wealth of the poor, the Guru of the guru−less, the honor of the dishonored. 992 : 132 I am blind; I have grasped hold of the jewel, the Guru. You are the strength of the weak. 992 : 133 He is not known through burnt offerings and ritual chanting; the True Lord is known through the Guru's Teachings. 992 : 134 Without the Naam, the Name of the Lord, no one finds shelter in the Court of the Lord; the false come and go in reincarnation. ||3|| Raag Maaroo − Part 004 17

992 : 135 So praise the True Name, and through the True Name, you will find satisfaction. 992 : 136 When the mind is cleaned with the jewel of spiritual wisdom, it does not become dirty again. 992 : 137 As long as the Lord and Master dwells in the mind, no obstacles are encountered. 992 : 138 O Nanak, giving one's head, one is emancipated, and the mind and body become true. ||4||10|| 992 : 139 Maaroo, First Mehl: 992 : 140 The Yogi who is joined to the Naam, the Name of the Lord, is pure; he is not stained by even a particle of dirt. 992 : 141 The True Lord, his Beloved, is always with him; the rounds of birth and death are ended for him. ||1|| 992 : 142 O Lord of the Universe, what is Your Name, and what is it like? 992 : 143 If You summon me into the Mansion of Your Presence, I will ask You, how I can become one with You. ||1||Pause|| Raag Maaroo − Part 004 18

992 : 144 He alone is a Brahmin, who takes his cleansing bath in the spiritual wisdom of God, and whose leaf−offerings in worship are the Glorious Praises of the Lord. 992 : 145 The One Name, the One Lord, and His One Light pervade the three worlds. ||2|| 992 : 146 My tongue is the balance of the scale, and this heart of mine is the pan of the scale; I weigh the immeasurable Naam. 992 : 147 There is one store, and one banker above all; the merchants deal in the one commodity. ||3|| 992 : 148 The True Guru saves us at both ends; he alone understands, who is lovingly focused on the One Lord; his inner being remains free of doubt. 992 : 149 The Word of the Shabad abides within, and doubt is ended, for those who constantly serve, day and night. ||4|| 992 : 150 Above is the sky of the mind, and beyond this sky is the Lord, the Protector of the World; the Inaccessible Lord God; the Guru abides there as well. 992 : 151 According to the Word of the Guru's Teachings, what is outside is the same as what is inside the home of the self. Nanak has become a detached renunciate. ||5||11|| −− Raag Maaroo − Part 004 −− Raag Maaroo − Part 004 19

Raag Maaroo − Part 005 993 : 152 Raag Maaroo, First Mehl, Fifth House: 993 : 153 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 993 : 154 Day and night, he remains awake and aware; he never sleeps or dreams. 993 : 155 He alone knows this, who feels the pain of separation from God. 993 : 156 My body is pierced through with the arrow of love. How can any physician know the cure? ||1|| 993 : 157 Rare is that one, who as Gurmukh, understands, and whom the True Lord links to His Praise. 993 : 158 He alone appreciates the value of the Ambsosial Nectar, who deals in this Ambrosia. ||1||Pause|| 993 : 159 The soul−bride is in love with her Husband Lord; 993 : 160 20

the focuses her consciousness on the Word of the Guru's Shabad. 993 : 161 The soul−bride is joyously embellished with intuitive ease; her hunger and thirst are taken away. ||2|| 993 : 162 Tear down skepticism and dispel your doubt; 993 : 163 with your intuition, draw the bow of the Praise of the Lord. 993 : 164 Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, conquer and subdue your mind; take the support of Yoga − Union with the beautiful Lord. ||3|| 993 : 165 Burnt by egotism, one forgets the Lord from his mind. 993 : 166 In the City of Death, he is attacked with massive swords. 993 : 167 Then, even if he asks for it, he will not receive the Lord's Name; O soul, you shall suffer terrible punishment. ||4|| 993 : 168 You are distracted by thoughts of Maya and worldly attachment. 993 : 169 In the City of Death, you will be caught by the noose of the Messenger of Death. Raag Maaroo − Part 005 21

993 : 170 You cannot break free from the bondage of loving attachment, and so the Messenger of Death will torture you. ||5|| 993 : 171 I have done nothing; I am doing nothing now. 993 : 172 The True Guru has blessed me with the Ambrosial Nectar of the Naam. 993 : 173 What other efforts can anyone make, when You bestow Your blessing? Nanak seeks Your Sanctuary. ||6||1||12|| 993 : 174 Maaroo, Third Mehl, First House: 993 : 175 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 993 : 176 Wherever You seat me, there I sit, O my Lord and Master; wherever You send me, there I go. 993 : 177 In the entire village, there is only One King; all places are sacred. ||1|| 993 : 178 O Baba, while I dwell in this body, let me sing Your True Praises, 993 : 179 Raag Maaroo − Part 005 22

that I may intuitively merge with You. ||1||Pause|| 993 : 180 He thinks that good and bad deeds come from himself; this is the source of all evil. 993 : 181 Whatever happens in this world is only by the Order of our Lord and Master. ||2|| 993 : 182 Sexual desires are so strong and compelling; where has this sexual desire come from? 993 : 183 The Creator Himself stages all the plays; how rare are those who realize this. ||3|| 993 : 184 By Guru's Grace, one is lovingly focused on the One Lord, and then, duality is ended. 993 : 185 Whatever is in harmony with His Will, he accepts as True; the noose of Death is loosened from around his neck. ||4|| 993 : 186 Prays Nanak, who can call him to account, when the egotistical pride of his mind has been silenced? 993 : 187 Even the Righteous Judge of Dharma is intimidated and afraid of him; he has entered the Sanctuary of the True Lord. ||5||1|| 993 : 188 Maaroo, Third Mehl: Raag Maaroo − Part 005 23

993 : 189 Coming and going in reincarnation no longer exist, when one dwells in the home of the self within. 993 : 190 He bestowed the Blessing of His treasure of truth; only He Himself knows. ||1|| −− Raag Maaroo − Part 005 −− Raag Maaroo − Part 005 24

Raag Maaroo − Part 006 994 : 191 O my mind, remember the Dear Lord, and abandon the corruption of your mind. 994 : 192 Meditate on the Word of the Guru's Shabad; focus lovingly on the Truth. ||1||Pause|| 994 : 193 One who forgets the Name in this world, shall not find any place of rest anywhere else. 994 : 194 He shall wander in all sorts of reincarnations, and rot away in manure. ||2|| 994 : 195 By great good fortune, I have found the Guru, according to my pre−ordained destiny, O my mother. 994 : 196 Night and day, I practice true devotional worship; I am united with the True Lord. ||3|| 994 : 197 He Himself fashioned the entire universe; He Himself bestows His Glance of Grace. 994 : 198 O Nanak, the Naam, the Name of the Lord, is glorious and great; as He pleases, He bestows His Blessings. ||4||2|| 994 : 199 Maaroo, Third Mehl: 25

994 : 200 Please forgive my past mistakes, O my Dear Lord; now, please place me on the Path. 994 : 201 I remain attached to the Lord's Feet, and eradicate self−conceit from within. ||1|| 994 : 202 O my mind, as Gurmukh, meditate on the Name of the Lord. 994 : 203 Remain attached forever to the Lord's Feet, single−mindedly, with love for the One Lord. ||1||Pause|| 994 : 204 I have no social status or honor; I have no place or home. 994 : 205 Pierced through by the Word of the Shabad, my doubts have been cut away. The Guru has inspired me to understand the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||2|| 994 : 206 This mind wanders around, driven by greed, totally attached to greed. 994 : 207 He is engrossed in false pursuits; he shall endure beatings in the City of Death. ||3|| 994 : 208 O Nanak, God Himself Himself is all−in−all. There is no other at all. 994 : 209 Raag Maaroo − Part 006 26

He bestows the treasure of devotional worship, and the Gurmukhs abide in peace. ||4||3|| 994 : 210 Maaroo, Third Mehl: 994 : 211 Seek and find those who are imbued with Truth; they are so rare in this world. 994 : 212 Meeting with them, one's face becomes radiant and bright, chanting the Name of the Lord. ||1|| 994 : 213 O Baba, contemplate and cherish the True Lord and Master within your heart. 994 : 214 Seek out and see, and ask your True Guru, and obtain the true commodity. ||1||Pause|| 994 : 215 All serve the One True Lord; through pre−ordained destiny, they meet Him. 994 : 216 The Gurmukhs merge with Him, and will not be separated from Him again; they attain the True Lord. ||2|| 994 : 217 Some do not appreciate the value of devotional worship; the self−willed manmukhs are deluded by doubt. 994 : 218 They are fillled with self−conceit; they cannot accomplish anything. ||3|| Raag Maaroo − Part 006 27

994 : 219 Stand and offer your prayer, to the One who cannot be moved by force. 994 : 220 O Nanak, the Naam, the Name of the Lord, abides within the mind of the Gurmukh; hearing his prayer, the Lord applauds him. ||4||4|| 994 : 221 Maaroo, Third Mehl: 994 : 222 He transforms the burning desert into a cool oasis; he transmutes rusted iron into gold. 994 : 223 So praise the True Lord; there is none other as great as He is. ||1|| 994 : 224 O my mind, night and day, meditate on the Lord's Name. 994 : 225 Contemplate the Word of the Guru's Teachings, and sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord, night and day. ||1||Pause|| 994 : 226 As Gurmukh, one comes to know the One Lord, when the True Guru instructs him. 994 : 227 Praise the True Guru, who imparts this understanding. ||2|| 994 : 228 Raag Maaroo − Part 006 28

Those who forsake the True Guru, and attach themselves to duality − what will they do when they go to the world hereafter? 994 : 229 Bound and gagged in the City of Death, they will be beaten. They will be punished severely. ||3|| −− Raag Maaroo − Part 006 −− Raag Maaroo − Part 006 29

Raag Maaroo − Part 007 995 : 230 My God is independent and self−sufficient; he does not have even an iota of greed. 995 : 231 O Nanak, run to His Sanctuary; granting His forgiveness, He merges us into Himself. ||4||5|| 995 : 232 Maaroo, Fourth Mehl, Second House: 995 : 233 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 995 : 234 Suk−deva and Janak meditated on the Naam; following the Guru's Teachings, they sought the Sanctuary of the Lord, Har, Har. 995 : 235 God met Sudama and removed his poverty; through loving devotional worship, he crossed over. 995 : 236 God is the Lover of His devotees; the Lord's Name is fufilling; God showers His Mercy on the Gurmukhs. ||1|| 995 : 237 O my mind, chanting the Naam, the Name of the Lord, you will be saved. 995 : 238 30

Dhroo, Prahlaad and Bidar the slave−girl's son, became Gurmukh, and through the Naam, crossed over. ||1||Pause|| 995 : 239 In this Dark Age of Kali Yuga, the Naam is the supreme wealth; it saves the humble devotees. 995 : 240 All the faults of Naam Dayv, Jai Dayv, Kabeer, Trilochan and Ravi Daas the leather−worker were covered. 995 : 241 Those who become Gurmukh, and remain attached to the Naam, are saved; all their sins are washed off. ||2|| 995 : 242 Whoever chants the Naam, all his sins and mistakes are taken away. 995 : 243 Ajaamal, who had sex with prostitites, was saved, by chanting the Name of the Lord. 995 : 244 Chanting the Naam, Ugar Sain obtained salvation; his bonds were broken, and he was liberated. ||3|| 995 : 245 God Himself takes pity on His humble servants, and makes them His own. 995 : 246 My Lord of the Universe saves the honor of His servants; those who seek His Sanctuary are saved. Raag Maaroo − Part 007 31

995 : 247 The Lord has showered servant Nanak with His Mercy; he has enshrined the Lord's Name within his heart. ||4||1|| 995 : 248 Maaroo, Fourth Mehl: 995 : 249 The Siddhas in Samaadhi meditate on Him; they are lovingly focused on Him. The seekers and the silent sages meditate on Him as well. 995 : 250 The celibates, the true and contented beings meditate on Him; Indra and the other gods chant His Name with their mouths. 995 : 251 Those who seek His Sanctuary meditate on Him; they become Gurmukh and swim across. ||1|| 995 : 252 O my mind, chant the Naam, the Name of the Lord, and cross over. 995 : 253 Dhanna the farmer, and Balmik the highway robber, became Gurmukh, and crossed over. ||1||Pause|| 995 : 254 Angels, men, heavenly heralds and celestial singers meditate on Him; even the humble Rishis sing of the Lord. 995 : 255 Raag Maaroo − Part 007 32

Shiva, Brahma and the goddess Lakhshmi, meditate, and chant with their mouths the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. 995 : 256 Those whose minds are drenched with the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, as Gurmukh, cross over. ||2|| 995 : 257 Millions and millions, three hundred thirty million gods meditate on Him; there is no end to those who meditate on the Lord. 995 : 258 The Vedas, the Puraanas and the Simritees meditate on the Lord; the Pandits, the religious scholars, sing the Lord's Praises as well. 995 : 259 Those whose minds are filled with the Naam, the source of nectar − as Gurmukh, they cross over. ||3|| 995 : 260 Those who chant the Naam in endless waves − I cannot even count their number. 995 : 261 The Lord of the Universe bestows His Mercy, and those who are pleasing to the Mind of the Lord God, find their place. 995 : 262 The Guru, granting His Grace, implants the Lord's Name within; servant Nanak chants the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||4||2|| −− Raag Maaroo − Part 007 −− Raag Maaroo − Part 007 33

Raag Maaroo − Part 008 996 : 263 Maaroo, Fourth Mehl, Third House: 996 : 264 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 996 : 265 Take the treasure of the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. Follow the Guru's Teachings, and the Lord shall bless you with honor. 996 : 266 Here and hereafter, the Lord goes with you; in the end, He shall deliver you. 996 : 267 Where the path is difficult and the street is narrow, there the Lord shall liberate you. ||1|| 996 : 268 O my True Guru, implant within me the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. 996 : 269 The Lord is my mother, father, child and relative; I have none other than the Lord, O my mother. ||1||Pause|| 996 : 270 I feel the pains of love and yearning for the Lord, and the Name of the Lord. If only someone would come and unite me with Him, O my mother. 996 : 271 34

I bow in humble devotion to one who inspires me to meet with my Beloved. 996 : 272 The almighty and merciful True Guru unites me with the Lord God instantaneously. ||2|| 996 : 273 Those who do not remember the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, are most unfortunate, and are slaughtered. 996 : 274 They wander in reincarnation, again and again; they die, and are re−born, and continue coming and going. 996 : 275 Bound and gagged at Death's Door, they are cruelly beaten, and punished in the Court of the Lord. ||3|| 996 : 276 O God, I seek Your Sanctuary; O my Sovereign Lord King, please unite me with Yourself. 996 : 277 O Lord, Life of the World, please shower me with Your Mercy; grant me the Sanctuary of the Guru, the True Guru. 996 : 278 The Dear Lord, becoming merciful, has blended servant Nanak with Himself. ||4||1||3|| 996 : 279 Maaroo, Fourth Mehl: 996 : 280 Raag Maaroo − Part 008 35

I inquire about the commodity of the Naam, the Name of the Lord. Is there anyone who can show me the wealth, the capital of the Lord? 996 : 281 I cut myself into pieces, and make myself a sacrifice to that one who leads me to meet my Lord God. 996 : 282 I am filled with the Love of my Beloved; how can I meet my Friend, and merge with Him? ||1|| 996 : 283 O my beloved friend, my mind, I take the wealth, the capital of the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. 996 : 284 The Perfect Guru has implanted the Naam within me; the Lord is my support − I celebrate the Lord. ||1||Pause|| 996 : 285 O my Guru, please unite me with the Lord, Har, Har; show me the wealth, the capital of the Lord. 996 : 286 Without the Guru, love does not well up; see this, and know it in your mind. 996 : 287 The Lord has installed Himself within the Guru; so praise the Guru, who unites us with the Lord. ||2|| 996 : 288 The ocean, the treasure of devotional worship of the Lord, rests with the Perfect True Guru. Raag Maaroo − Part 008 36

996 : 289 When it pleases the True Guru, He opens the treasure, and and the Gurmukhs are illuminated by the Lord's Light. 996 : 290 The unfortunate self−willed manmukhs die of thirst, on the very bank of the river. ||3|| 996 : 291 The Guru is the Great Giver; I beg for this gift from the Guru, 996 : 292 that He may unite me with God, from whom I was separated for so long! This is the great hope of my mind and body. 996 : 293 If it pleases You, O my Guru, please listen to my prayer; this is servant Nanak's prayer. ||4||2||4|| 996 : 294 Maaroo, Fourth Mehl: 996 : 295 O Lord God, please preach Your sermon to me. 1087 : 4272 I have cut down the fortress of duality and doubt, attachment, greed and egotism. 1087 : 4273 The Name of the Lord abides within my mind; I contemplate the Word of the Guru's Shabad. 1087 : 4274 Through Truth, self−discipline and sublime understanding, the Lord has become very dear to me. 1087 : 4275 Truly, truly, the True Creator Lord is all−pervading. ||1|| 1087 : 4276 Shalok, Third Mehl: 1087 : 4277 Among the ragas, Kaydaaraa Raga is known as good, O Siblings of Destiny, if through it, one comes to love the Word of the Shabad, 1087 : 4278 and if one remains in the Soceity of the Saints, and enshrines love for the True Lord. 1087 : 4279 Such a person washes away the pollution from within, and saves his generations as well. 1087 : 4280 He gathes in the capital of virtue, and destroys and drives out unvirtuous sins. 1087 : 4281 Raag Maaroo − Part 099 520

O Nanak, he alone is known as united, who does not forsake his Guru, and who does not love duality. ||1|| 1087 : 4282 Fourth Mehl: 1087 : 4283 Gazing upon the world−ocean, I am afraid of death; but if I live in the Fear of You, God, then I am not afraid. 1087 : 4284 Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, I am content; O Nanak, I blossom forth in the Name. ||2|| 1087 : 4285 Fourth Mehl: 1087 : 4286 I get on board the boat and set out, but the ocean is churning with waves. 1087 : 4287 The boat of Truth encounters no obstruction, if the Guru gives encouragement. 1087 : 4288 He takes us across to the door on the other side, as the Guru keeps watch. 1087 : 4289 O Nanak, if I am blessed with His Grace, I shall go to His Court with honor. ||3|| 1087 : 4290 Pauree: Raag Maaroo − Part 099 521

1087 : 4291 Enjoy your kingdom of bliss; as Gurmukh, practice Truth. 1087 : 4292 Sitting upon the throne of Truth, the Lord administers justice; He unites us in Union with the Society of the Saints. 1087 : 4293 Meditating on the Lord, through the True Teachings, we become just like the Lord. 1087 : 4294 If the Lord, the Giver of peace, abides in the mind, in this world, then in the end, He becomes our help and support. 1087 : 4295 Love for the Lord wells up, when the Guru imparts understanding. ||2|| 1087 : 4296 Shalok, First Mehl: 1087 : 4297 Confused and deluded, I wander around, but no one shows me the way. 1087 : 4298 I go and ask the clever people, if there is there anyone who can rid me of my pain. 1087 : 4299 If the True Guru abides within my mind, then I see the Lord, my best friend, there. 1087 : 4300 Raag Maaroo − Part 099 522

O Nanak, my mind is satisfied and fulfilled, contemplating the Praises of the True Name. ||1|| 1087 : 4301 Third Mehl: 1087 : 4302 He Himself is the Doer, and He is the deed; He Himself issues the Command. 1087 : 4303 He Himself forgives some, and He Himself does the deed. 1087 : 4304 O Nanak, receiving the Divine Light from the Guru, suffering and corruption are burnt away, through the Name. ||2|| 1087 : 4305 Pauree: 1087 : 4306 Don't be fooled by gazing at the riches of Maya, you foolish self−willed manmukh. 1087 : 4307 It shall not go along with you when you must depart; all the wealth you see is false. 1087 : 4308 The blind and ignorant do not understand, that the sword of death is hanging over their heads. 1087 : 4309 By Guru's Grace, those who drink in the sublime essence of the Lord are saved. Don't worry, O my soul; speak the Truth, O Nanak, the Truth, and only the Truth. ||2|| 1088 : 4319 Pauree: 1088 : 4320 The Lord Himself forgives the Gurmukhs; they are absorbed and immersed in the Lord's Name. 1088 : 4321 He Himself links them to devotional worship; they bear the Insignia of the Guru's Shabad. 1088 : 4322 Those who turn towards the Guru, as sunmukh, are beautiful. Drinking in the sublime essence of the Lord, they remain satisfied forever; their hunger and thirst are quenched. ||5|| 1088 : 4337 Shalok, Third Mehl: 1088 : 4338 Her Husband Lord is pleased, and He enjoys His bride; the soul−bride adorns her heart with the Naam, the Name of the Lord. 1088 : 4339 O Nanak, that bride who stands before Him, is the most noble and respected woman. ||1|| 1088 : 4340 First Mehl: 1088 : 4341 In her father−in−law's home hereafter, and in her parents' home in this world, she belongs to her Husband Lord. Be absorbed in the Lord's True Love, and imbued with the deep color of the Lord's Infinite Love. 1088 : 4355 O Nanak, by Guru's Grace, one is emancipated, if the consciousness is attached to the True Lord. ||2|| 1088 : 4356 Pauree: 1088 : 4357 The Name of the Lord is priceless. 1089 : 4377 The Naam, the Name of the Lord, is the charity I beg for; contentment is my temple. 1089 : 4396 One who puts his faith in the treasure of his Beloved Lord is blessed; he exalts and embellishes others as well. 1089 : 4397 One who realizes the Hukam of God's Command − his face is radiant and bright; he floats across, like iron upon wood. 1089 : 4398 Forsake thirst and desire, and abide in the Fear of God; O Nanak, these are the most excellent actions. ||1|| 1089 : 4399 Third Mehl: 1089 : 4400 The ignorant people who go to the desert to conquer their minds, are not able to conquer them. 1089 : 4401 O Nanak, if this mind is to be conquered, one must contemplate the Word of the Guru's Shabad. 1089 : 4402 This mind is not conquered by conquering it, even though everyone longs to do so. 1089 : 4403 O Nanak, the mind itself conquers the mind, if one meets with the True Guru. ||2|| −− Raag Maaroo − Part 101 −− Raag Maaroo − Part 101 535

Raag Maaroo − Part 102 1090 : 4404 Pauree: 1090 : 4405 He created both sides; Shiva dwells within Shakti (the soul dwells within the material universe). 1090 : 4406 Through the material universe of Shakti, no one has ever found the Lord; they continue to be born and die in reincarnation. 1090 : 4407 Serving the Guru, peace is found, meditating on the Lord with every breath and morsel of food. 1090 : 4408 Searching and looking through the Simritees and the Shaastras, I have found that the most sublime person is the slave of the Lord. 1090 : 4409 O Nanak, without the Naam, nothing is permanent and stable; I am a sacrifice to the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||10|| 1090 : 4410 Shalok, Third Mehl: 1090 : 4411 I might become a Pandit, a religious scholar, or an astrologer, and recite the four Vedas with my mouth; 536

1090 : 4412 I might be worshipped throughout the nine regions of the earth for my wisdom and thought; 1090 : 4413 let me not forget the Word of Truth, that no one can touch my sacred cooking square. 1090 : 4414 Such cooking squares are false, O Nanak; only the One Lord is True. ||1|| 1090 : 4415 Third Mehl: 1090 : 4416 He Himself creates and He Himself acts; He bestows His Glance of Grace. 1090 : 4417 He Himself grants glorious greatness; says Nanak, He is the True Lord. ||2|| 1090 : 4418 Pauree: 1090 : 4419 Only death is painful; I cannot conceive of anything else as painful. 1090 : 4420 It is unstoppable; it stalks and pervades the world, and fights with the sinners. 1090 : 4421 Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, one is immersed in the Lord. 1090 : 4422 He alone is emancipated in the Sanctuary of the Lord, who struggles with his own mind. 1090 : 4423 One who contemplates and meditates on the Lord in his mind, succeeds in the Court of the Lord. ||11|| 1090 : 4424 Shalok, First Mehl: 1090 : 4425 Submit to the Will of the Lord Commander; in His Court, only Truth is accepted. 1090 : 4426 Your Lord and Master shall call you to account; do not go astray on beholding the world. 1090 : 4427 One who keeps watch over his heart, and keeps his heart pure, is a dervish, a saintly devotee. 1090 : 4428 Love and affection, O Nanak, are in the accounts placed before the Creator. ||1|| 1090 : 4429 First Mehl: 1090 : 4430 One who is unattached like the bumble bee, sees the Lord of the world everywhere. 1090 : 4431 Raag Maaroo − Part 102 538

The diamond of his mind is pierced through with the Diamond of the Lord's Name; O Nanak, his neck is embellished with it. ||2|| 1090 : 4432 Pauree: 1090 : 4433 The self−willed manmukhs are afflicted by death; they cling to Maya in emotional attachment. 1090 : 4434 In an instant, they are thrown to the ground and killed; in the love of duality, they are deluded. 1090 : 4435 This opportunity shall not come into their hands again; they are beaten by the Messenger of Death with his stick. 1090 : 4436 But Death's stick does not even strike those who remain awake and aware in the Love of the Lord. 1090 : 4437 All are Yours, and cling to You; only You can save them. ||12|| 1090 : 4438 Shalok, First Mehl: 1090 : 4439 See the imperishable Lord everywhere; attachment to wealth brings only great pain. 1090 : 4440 Raag Maaroo − Part 102 539

Loaded with dust, you have to cross over the world−ocean; you are not carrying the profit and capital of the Name with you. ||1|| 1090 : 4441 First Mehl: 1090 : 4442 My capital is Your True Name, O Lord; this wealth is inexhaustible and infinite. 1090 : 4443 O Nanak, this merchandise is immaculate; blessed is the banker who trades in it. ||2|| 1090 : 4444 First Mehl: 1090 : 4445 Know and enjoy the primal, eternal Love of the Great Lord and Master. 1090 : 4446 Blessed with the Naam, O Nanak, you shall strike down the Messenger of Death, and push his face to the ground. ||3|| 1090 : 4447 Pauree: 1090 : 4448 He Himself has embellished the body, and placed the nine treasures of the Naam within it. 1090 : 4449 He confuses some in doubt; fruitless are their actions. 1090 : 4450 Some, as Gurmukh, realize their Lord, the Supreme Soul. 1090 : 4451 Some listen to the Lord, and obey Him; sublime and exalted are their actions. 1090 : 4452 Love for the Lord wells up deep within, singing the Glorious Praises of the Lord's Name. ||13|| 1090 : 4453 Shalok, First Mehl: −− Raag Maaroo − Part 102 −− Raag Maaroo − Part 102 541

1091 : 4463 O Nanak, without the True Name, no one's hunger is appeased. ||3|| 1091 : 4464 Pauree: 1091 : 4465 Those who search their inner beings, through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, are exalted and adorned. 1091 : 4466 They obtain what they wish for, meditating on the Lord's Name. 1091 : 4467 One who is blessed by God's Grace, meets with the Guru; he sings the Glorious Praises of the Lord. 1091 : 4468 The Righteous Judge of Dharma is his friend; he does not have to walk on the Path of Death. 1091 : 4469 He meditates on the Lord's Name, day and night; he is absorbed and immersed in the Lord's Name. ||14|| 1091 : 4470 Shalok, First Mehl: 1091 : 4471 Listen to and speak the Name of the One Lord, who permeates the heavens, this world and the nether regions of the underworld. 1091 : 4472 The Hukam of His Command cannot be erased; whatever He has written, shall go with the mortal. 1091 : 4473 Who has died, and who kills? There is no other at all. ||16|| 1092 : 4504 Shalok, Third Mehl: 1092 : 4505 In this world, the Saints earn the wealth; they come to meet God through the True Guru. 1092 : 4506 The True Guru implants the Truth within; the value of this wealth cannot be described. 1092 : 4507 Obtaining this wealth, hunger is relieved, and peace comes to dwell in the mind. 1092 : 4508 Only those who have such pre−ordained destiny, come to receive this. 1092 : 4509 The world of the self−willed manmukh is poor, crying out for Maya. 548

1092 : 4510 Night and day, it wanders continually, and its hunger is never relieved. 1092 : 4511 It never finds calm tranquility, and peace never comes to dwell in its mind. 1092 : 4512 It is always plagued by anxiety, and its cynicism never departs. 1092 : 4513 O Nanak, without the True Guru, the intellect is perverted; if one meets the True Guru, then one practices the Word of the Shabad. 1092 : 4514 Forever and ever, he dwells in peace, and merges in the True Lord. ||1|| 1092 : 4515 Third Mehl: 1092 : 4516 The One who created the world, takes care of it. 1092 : 4517 Meditate in remembrance on the One Lord, O Siblings of Destiny; there is none other than Him. 1092 : 4518 So eat the food of the Shabad and goodness; eating it, you shall remain satisfied forever. 1092 : 4519 Raag Maaroo − Part 104 549

Dress yourself in the Praise of the Lord. Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, the Lord's Court is known; within the self is the Sanctuary, the Mansion of the Lord's Presence. 1092 : 4539 The coins are assayed, and the genuine coins are placed in His treasury, while the counterfeit ones find no place. 1092 : 4540 The Truest of the True is all−pervading; His justice is forever True. 1092 : 4541 One comes to enjoy the Ambrosial essence, when the Name is enshrined in the mind. ||18|| 1092 : 4542 Shalok, First Mehl: 1092 : 4543 When one acts in egotism, then You are not there, Lord.
